summary: Converted the texture on the grey vampire armor to black. I never liked the washed out grey color.
descriptionHtml:
[img]http://static-2.nexusmods.com/15/mods/110/images/61072-1-1419574724.jpg[/img]
[b][size=5]
[/size][/b]This is just a simple texture edit that converts the Grey Vampire Leather Armor from Dawnguard to black for both male and female characters.

When I play as a Spellsword, I find that the vampire armor is pretty decent early in the game (if you find it with a good enchant). I did not like
the washed out grey version so I decided to make it black. I actually used the red armor as the base of the conversion since it already had a dark black shirt but used it as a replacement texture for the grey armor.

It's just two texture files. No .eps required. Use NMM to install or uninstall. Since it's just a texture over-write it's save game safe. It uses what ever size the Bethesda HiRes pack uses. I think those are 2K.
[size=3]
NEXUS EXCLUSIVE. FREE.
If you see this mod somewhere else, I did not put it there nor did I give permission to put it there. [/size]

data\textures\dlc01\clothes\vampire\robes_alt.dds
data\textures\dlc01\clothes\vampire\robesf_alt.dds

Process
I'm not a texture artist or designer.Â  I do know a bit about Photoshop from my photography hobby and work in web site programming.

[list=1][*]Opened in PS with the nVidia plugin.
[/*]
[*]Added a BW layer set to High Contract Blue Filter[/*]
[*]Ran a contrast mask on it to sharpen it up a bit.[/*]
[*]Saved.[/*]
[/list]
Permissions
It's just a quick Photoshop edit of the Bethesda Hi-Res DLC texture. Treat it as you would any Bethesda texture.
